availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Howard (Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer, deputy sheriff; 1st lieut & capt 49th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer, deputy sheriff, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Slusher Howard and Elizabeth Howard. Farmer in Harlan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Deputy sheriff of Magoffin County in 1863. Served in the 49th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and captain from September 19, 1863, to December 26. 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 1, p. 40B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, Licking Station, p. 48.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0449.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 496.
Find A Grave, "Benjamin F. Howard (1830-1904)," Memorial #10857970, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10857970 (accessed May 14, 2020).
KYR-0001-004-0332.
